description.narrative: The education system, particularly in the four departments receiving UNICEF support, have increased capacity to plan, implement and monitor innovative and flexible learning modalities for vulnerable and marginalised adolescents., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, have increased access to, learning and completion of quality education services, including in emergency situations.

sector.narrative: Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.
System strengthening - curricula and learning materials design (excluding early-learning / pre-primary)
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.
System strengthening - life skills (for personal empowerment, active citizenship, etc.)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: The education system, particularly in the four departments receiving UNICEF support, have increased capacity to plan, implement and monitor innovative and flexible learning modalities for vulnerable and marginalised adolescents.

description.narrative: The results achieved within the output area include improvement and diversification of educational services, especially for populations in situation of vulnerability. For example, UNICEF worked with the Ministry of Education to design an educational modality for Adolescents in Conflict with the Law. At the same time, the application of the MESCP in 713 schools continued. Finally, UNICEF implemented innovative initiatives with teenagers and new technologies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: # of studies conducted and disseminated at the departmental level, with support from UNICEF, that contain evidence regarding the situation of boys and girls not in school

target.value: 2022:4 departamentos (La Paz, Cochabamba, Santa Cruz, Pando)

title.narrative: # of primary and secondary teachers who have increased their knowledge, with support from UNICEF, regarding innovative and flexible learning modalities for socially-disadvantaged children and adolescents

target.value: 2022:TBC based on baseline data (in Cobija, Gonzalo Moreno, Puerto Villaroel, Chimore, Independencia, El Alto)

title.narrative: Service Delivery - Number of children/adolescents studying lower secondary education through alternative modes of delivery (formal or non formal, e.g. evening school, weekend school, distance learning) with support from UNICEF
